bwwExcerpt: The cast includes a handful of sterling performances, led by Pasquale (of The Bridges of Madison County) who makes Merkin an antihero we can both root for and recoil from. Stram gives one of his typically excellent performances as the white-glove lawyer; Aghayere is especially strong as the low-level lawyer playing both sides; and Siberry, who has a long line of credits including a not-very-comfortable Captain von Trapp in the 1998 Sound of Music, is riveting as the malevolent and bigoted Tresle
